critique: This document is an executive order that delegates authority to the Secretary of the Interior to sign orders related to withdrawing or reserving public lands. It includes provisions for oversight by the Director of the Bureau of the Budget and the Attorney General, as well as concurrence from other relevant department heads. There is nothing about Ideological Tilt, Immigration Approach, National Security vs. Civil Liberties, Economic Regulation, or Social Inclusion. The executive power is somewhat expanded, and the federalism is leaning towards federal control.
